Class LinearModel

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.LinearModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
EstimationFunction, ScalarEstimationFunction, TrainableScalarFunction, TrainableFunction
Direct Known Subclasses:
LinearCombination
@TemplateMethod public abstract class LinearModel extends Object implements TrainableScalarFunction
Abstract base class for linear scalar models of the form: 
   f(x) = bias + Î£ w_i * x_i
where parameters[0] is the bias and parameters[1..] are the weights.

Implements TrainableScalarFunction, exposing direct accessors and mutators for weights and bias, as well as parameter adjustments used during training.

  • Constructor Summary

    LinearModel(float[] parameters)
    Creates a new linear model with the given parameter vector.

  • Constructor Details

    • LinearModel

      public LinearModel(float[] parameters)
      Creates a new linear model with the given parameter vector.

      The first element is the bias, subsequent elements are the weights.

      Parameters:
      parameters - bias and weight parameters of the model

  • Method Details

    • getParameters

      public float[] getParameters()
      Returns the full parameter vector of this model. The first element is the bias, the rest are the weights.
      Specified by:
      getParameters in interface TrainableFunction
      Returns:
      the parameter array

    • arity

      public int arity()
      Returns the number of input features this model accepts, equal to the number of weights (parameters.length - 1).
      Specified by:
      arity in interface EstimationFunction
      Returns:
      the arity (number of input dimensions)

    • validDimension

      protected final int validDimension(int d)
      Checks if a given dimension index is valid.
      Parameters:
      d - dimension index, starting from 1
      Returns:
      the same index if valid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if d is out of range

    • getWeights

      public float[] getWeights()
      Returns a copy of the weights (all parameters except the bias).
      Returns:
      the weight vector

    • setWeights

      public void setWeights(float[] weights)
      Replaces all weights with the given vector.
      Parameters:
      weights - the new weight vector
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of weights does not match arity()

    • getWeight

      public float getWeight(int d)
      Returns the weight for a given dimension (1-based).
      Parameters:
      d - dimension index, starting from 1
      Returns:
      the weight value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if d is out of range

    • setWeight

      public void setWeight(int d, float weight)
      Sets the weight for a given dimension (1-based).
      Parameters:
      d - dimension index, starting from 1
      weight - the new weight value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if d is out of range

    • adjustWeight

      public void adjustWeight(int d, float delta)
      Adjusts the weight for a given dimension (1-based) by adding delta.
      Parameters:
      d - dimension index, starting from 1
      delta - the adjustment value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if d is out of range

    • getBias

      public float getBias()
      Returns the bias parameter.
      Returns:
      the bias value (0.0f if there are no parameters)

    • setBias

      public void setBias(float bias)
      Sets the bias parameter.
      Parameters:
      bias - the new bias value

    • adjustBias

      public void adjustBias(float delta)
      Adjusts the bias parameter by adding delta.
      Parameters:
      delta - the adjustment value
